intro: Achyronia propinqua, commonly known as the small-flowered achyronia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a slender, branching stem with narrow leaves. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and small, aromatic leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, making it a notable plant in its native desert environments.
